repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: emm problem is when jump to second section , before section still has highlight. are you sure there invoke `exit` is correct.  snippet should still available.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -278,13 +278,26 @@ local function setup_autocmds(bufnr)
     desc = 'Update snippet state when the cursor moves',
     buffer = bufnr,
     callback = function()
+      local cursor_row, cursor_col = cursor_pos()
+
+      -- The cursor left the snippet region.
+      local snippet_range = get_extmark_range(bufnr, M._session.extmark_id)
+      if
+        cursor_row < snippet_range[1]
+        or (cursor_row == snippet_range[1] and cursor_col < snippet_range[2])
+        or cursor_row > snippet_range[3]
+        or (cursor_row == snippet_range[3] and cursor_col > snippet_range[4])
+      then
+        M.exit()

comment_data.body:
You mean jumping to the second tabstop? As long as you don't leave the inserted snippet text, the highlights should remain.

I'm wary of modifying this further, since different users might want the snippet to be cancelled at different moments.

comment_data.body:
when jump to next or before tabstop. before tabstop highlight should remove not keep.

like if i leave to normal still have highlight. this is not correct. otherwise it's better not add any highlight.

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/41671631/c07b8d6a-c314-4a38-875f-bdc917c3dd16)

comment_data.body:
prefer something like 
```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua
index 7680d2e..50ab080 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/snippet.lua
@@ -504,6 +504,8 @@ end
 ---
 --- @param direction (vim.snippet.Direction) Navigation direction. -1 for previous, 1 for next.
 function M.jump(direction)
+  local line = vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)[1]
+  vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(0, snippet_ns, line, line + 1)
   -- Get the tabstop index to jump to.
   local dest_index = M._session and M._session:get_dest_index(direction)
   if not dest_index then
```

comment_data.body: The highlights are applied to the tabstops of an active snippet. I would like other people to weigh in on how customizable the highlights should be before I make any more changes.

comment_data.body:
> when jump to next or before tabstop. before tabstop highlight should remove not keep.

No. As long as you _can_ jump to these tabstops, they should remain to be highlighted, since you can always jump back.

The highlights should only disappear (together with the extmarks themselves) once you `exit` the snippet -- either manually or by jumping to `$0`.

comment_data.body: Not bug. Highlight shows all tabstops while the snippet is active. If the snippet is exited, all highlights should disappear. Anything else is too fancy.

title: fix(lsp): cancel session when leaving snippet region
